content.title: Scholarship For Transgender Students
content.details: The scheme 'Scholarship for Transgender Students' was launched by the Social Justice Department, Government of Kerala for providing scholarships to Transgender students from 7th standard onwards studying in State Government/ Government aided/ Self Financing schools. The Transgender community faces many problems such as fear, shame, social discrimination, depression, suicidal tendencies, and social stigma. They are unable to live a dignified life, once their gender status is revealed. Steps must be taken to create public awareness so that Transgender feel that they are a part of society and are not treated as untouchables. As an effort to bring marginalized Transgender communities to the mainstream of society, Social Justice Department has initiated this scheme.
benefits: For Transgender students from 7th std. to 10th std.: ₹1000/- per month for 10 months
For Transgender students studying in Plus One & Plus Two: ₹1500/- per month for 10 months
For Transgender students pursuing Diploma, Degree, Post-Graduation, or Professional courses: ₹2000/- per month for 10 months
eligibility: Applicant should be a resident of Kerala.
Applicant should be a student and studying in State Government/ Government aided/ Self Financing schools/colleges.
The applicant should be studying in 7th Class to Diploma/Degree/PG Level.
content.application_process: Online and Offline. Registration Process: To avail of the benefits of the scheme, the applicant needs to visit SUNEETHI- Online Service Application Portal. Follow the steps for registration and application as detailed in the scheme description.
documents_required: Identity card i.e. Aadhaar Card, Election ID/ Voter ID
Self-declaration Affidavit stating that the applicant is Transgender.
Bank details- Copy of Pass Book
Certificate issued by the Principal of the Educational Institution
The applicant who has not completed 18 years of age Parent's Certificate / Applicant who has completed 18 years of age and ID Card is not available-Self attested certificate.

faqs.question: What is the 'Scholarship for Transgender Students' scheme?
faqs.answer: Under the scheme, the scholarship is to be provided to Transgender students from 7th standard onwards studying in State Government/ Government aided/ Self Financing schools/colleges.

faqs.question: Which department has launched this scheme?
faqs.answer: Social Justice Department, Government of Kerala.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to get the benefits under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Transgender student who is studying in the 7th Class to Diploma/Degree/PG Level in State Government/ Government aided/ Self Financing schools/colleges are eligible to apply under the scheme.

faqs.question: Is this scheme only for transgender students?
faqs.answer: Yes, this scheme is only for transgender students.

faqs.question: Is this scheme only for a resident of Kerala State?
faqs.answer: Yes, the applicant should be a permanent resident of Kerala State.

faqs.question: Is there any income limit to apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: No, there is no income limit.

faqs.question: What is the benefit of the scheme?
faqs.answer: Under the scheme, scholarships of ₹1000/-, ₹1500/- & ₹2000/- may be given to transgender students who are studying in 7th Class to Diploma/Degree/PG Level in State Government/ Government aided/ Self Financing schools/colleges.

faqs.question: For how many months are the scholarships given to the students in a year?
How can an applicant apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The applicant may apply both online and offline mode.

faqs.question: Where can I find the application form to apply offline mode?
faqs.answer: The application form may be downloaded from the official website of the Social Justice Department, Kerala.

faqs.question: How can an applicant apply online under the scheme?
faqs.answer: For online application, the applicant should visit the Official Portal - the applicant need to visit SUNEETHI- Online Service Application Portal.
